title: Please help!
body:
So when I was updating my LOL client, which is the patch in which the new Urgot rework is presented. It never patched through and it completely broke down. And when I tried clicking the program. It would pop up this message everytime: 
> C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\LeagueClient.exe 
> The application has failed to start because its side-by-side configuration is incorrect. Please see the application event log or use the command-line sxstrace.exe tool for more detail.

I tried many solutions when searching this up, such as redownloading my visual c++ or deleting all of League and reinstalling it again. But that same message keeps popping up. But now after many attempts. I can't even get the new client since it has to be given through the old client. But when I go into the League of Legends directory folder and tried through there. That same message keeps popping up. 

**_Please help_**

replies.body: This error message is unusual, but I'm betting a security setting is denying your game files from being accessed.  To start, try out the steps in the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to make sure League is added as an exception.  Let me know if that helps.
I've tried that method, and it doesn't work.

No worries, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and our tech team can dig into this individually with you.  Download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) as well to obtain some logs and attach it to your ticket for context.  We'll get back to you there!
